intro: Erigeron dusenii, commonly known as Dusen's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It features slender stems with narrow, silvery-green leaves and produces small, white to pale blue flowers. Erigeron dusenii is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it thrives in cooler, high-altitude environments.
